required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction Accuracy for Langeal Mask Unique TM Size in Pediatric Patient
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction Accuracy for Langeal Mask Unique TM Size in Melayu Pediatric Population According to Weight Meissurement

brief_summary.textblock: the study aimed to know the accuracy for laryngeal mask unique TM size to Malay pediatric race according to weight measurement recommended by manufacturer

detailed_description.textblock: sixty-six pediatric subjects aged between 1 - 10 years old underwent general anesthesia using laryngeal mask Unique TM. Laryngeal mask inserted using the size based on subject's weight. Effectivity was confirmed if there is no air sound from patient's mouth, airway seal pressure ≥20 cmH2O, maximum inspiration pressure was ≤ 20 cmH2O, difference in expiration and inspiration tidal volume less than 5%, and there is no cuff appear in mouth.

primary_outcome.description: observe the sign of successful insertion of laryngeal mask

arm_group.description: laryngeal mask size determines according to weight measurement

intervention.description: the size of laryngeal mask given to the patient was based on patient's weight measurement

study_pop.textblock: pediatric population aged 1 - 10 years old underwent general anesthesia procedure with laryngeal mask airway device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged 1 -10 years old
- Malay race
- scheduled for general anesthesia procedure with laryngeal mask
Exclusion Criteria:
- disagree to be included in the study
